item.title: Where You Know Avowed's Voice Cast From
item.description:
Having a strong cast of characters is important for an RPG, especially one like Avowed that puts a heavy emphasis on dialogue choices and moral dilemmas. Thankfully, Avowed 's voice cast is generally very strong, with everyone doing a great job of repeatedly cementing Obsidian Entertainment's trademark tone that carefully balances high stakes and levity.

Players will meet a plethora of memorable characters during Avowed 's 20+ hour runtime, ranging from conniving villains to reluctant heroes and plenty in between. Of course, some of the most memorable characters are Avowed 's companions, many of whom might sound familiar to those who have been gaming for some time.

Avowed's Cast Has Some Recognizable Voices

Avowed's Yatzli - Anjali Bhimani

An energetic wizard, Yatzli is the final companion players will meet in Avowed . Yatzli is played by Anjali Bhimani, an actor who has worked on the following projects:

  • Symmetra - Overwatch
  • Rampart - Apex Legends
  • Commander Natara - Starfield
  • Izel - Diablo 4
  • Yasmin Chowdhury - Fallout 76
  • Auntie Ruby - Ms. Marvel

Avowed's Bragan - Jeff Leach

Though not one of Avowed 's companions, Jeff Leach lends his voice to Bragan. Leach has played the following roles:

  • Simon 'Ghost' Riley - Call of Duty: Modern Warfare (2019)
  • Arisen - Dragon's Dogma 2
  • Peeves - Harry Potter: Magic Awakened
  • World Tour Citizen - Street Fighter 6
  • Agent Greeves - Valorant

Jeff Leach was replaced by Samuel Roukin for the role of Ghost in Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 2 and 3 .

Avowed's Giatta - Mara Junot

The third companion players will recruit in Avowed , Giatta Castell is an Animancer who's determined to finish her deceased parents' work. Giatta is played by Mara Junot, who's had some prominent roles in the gaming space over the last decade or so:

  • Storm - Marvel Rivals
  • Storm - Marvel's Midnight Suns
  • Shoola - Arcane
  • Leslie Thompkins - Batman: Arkham Shadow
  • Sindel & Sareena - Mortal Kombat 1
  • Alleria Windrunner - World of Warcraft
  • Ikora Rey - Destiny 2
  • Zuri Abara - Starfield
  • Player - Remnant 2
  • Dr. Slone - Fortnite

Avowed's Kai - Brandon Keener

The breakout star of Avowed , Kai is the first companion players meet in the Living Lands. Mass Effect fans will instantly recognize Kai's voice, with it being the same as that series' beloved companion Garrus Vakarian. But there are plenty of other games Brandon Keener has appeared in:

  • Garrus Vakarian - Mass Effect
  • Detective Harold Caldwell - L.A. Noire
  • Sully Mathis - Fallout 4
  • Howler - Dishonored 2
  • Advent Speaker - XCOM 2
  • Salmael - Persona 5 Tactica

Avowed's Sargamis - Matthew Mercer

No introduction is needed for Matthew Mercer, one of the most prolific voice actors of the generation. Mercer has been doing voice work since the 1990s, and currently has 475 acting credits on IMDb. As well as playing Avowed 's Sargamis, some of his most notable projects include:

  • GM - Critical Role
  • Viper & Manfred - Dragon Age: The Veilguard
  • Anarky - Batman: Arkham
  • Vincent Valentine - Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth
  • Goro Majima - Like a Dragon: Infinite Wealth
  • Ganondorf - Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom
  • Chrom - Fire Emblem: Engage
  • Male Hunter - Marvel's Midnight Suns
  • Cassidy - Overwatch
  • Yusuke Kitagawa - Persona 5
  • Leon S. Kennedy - Resident Evil 6

Avowed's Marius - Scott Whyte

Along with working in the sound departments for movies like The Invisible Man and Brightburn , Scott Whyte plays Avowed 's second companion, Marius. Whyte has also voiced a variety of other video game characters, including:

  • Human Torch - Marvel Rivals
  • CO Hobbs - Batman: Arkham Shadow
  • Player - Remnant 2
  • Grindelwald - Harry Potter: Magic Awakened
  • Crash Bandicoot - Crash Bandicoot 4
  • Rathma - Diablo 4
  • Jake Wind - Death Stranding

item.title: Reverse: 1999 - Best Willow Build (Psychubes, Team Comps, & Skills)
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Willow Skills, Explained - Reverse: 1999
  • Best Psychubes For Willow In Reverse: 1999
  • Best Resonance Build For Willow In Reverse: 1999
  • Best Team Compositions For Willow In Reverse: 1999

Reverse: 1999 ’s Version 2.3 introduces a much-awaited Arcanist during the Chronicles of Uluru: London Dawning event. Willow is a 6-star Plant Arcanist who deals Mental Damage. She’s an Attack-type character and the first true Poison Damage character. She works well in practically any team, and that’s because she’s a great DPS .

Her skills are rather interesting in comparison to previous characters, and if you love to strategize during battles, she’s the one for you. Willow deals all kinds of damage, but scaling her off Poison is the best since it’s triggered with each turn. Here is everything you need to know about Willow’s build and how best to utilize her .

Willow Skills, Explained - Reverse: 1999

Willow is essentially a DPS built for Poison teams. Her most noticeable skill ( Hag’s Bane ) is a special kind of skill that allows her to scale her damage off how many times it has been triggered in a turn. Her Ultimate ( In The Fire, In The Shadow ) is her main mode of damage and works rather differently. The Ultimate increases her Moxie while also depleting it to inflict even more of Hag’s Bane .

To simplify, Willow is a Burst DMG DPS who applies status effects onto her enemies . She basically converts multiple instances of Poison into even more deadly Poison, which is Hag’s Bane, and as long as enemies are inflicted with its status, they will take constant damage. It is recommended to capitalize on this, as the more Hag’s Bane is resolved, the higher her Genesis Damage is. You can also create these instances through Willow’s Ultimate as it allows her to inflict multiple stacks of it .

Best Psychubes For Willow In Reverse: 1999

When it comes to Psychubes, Willow’s signature Offbeat Strides is the best for her. It basically maxes out her Moxie the moment she steps on the field. Moreover, it also increases her Genesis DMG, DMG Taken Reduction, and Poison Damage. With her Moxie at maximum from the start of the fight, it means you can utilize her Ultimate well. For a second option, you can use Her Mournful Face , which is your budget option Psychube for Willow. It’s great because it increases Poison damage by 40%, and that’s something you definitely need for her.

Next, you can try out either Silent and Adoring or Transcendent Love on her. Both of them have their own attributes, but their ATK% substat is what’s most beneficial for Willow. Silent and Adoring basically stacks up damage for Willow when her Channel ends, and Transcendent Love helps her stack up Crit Rate and Crit DMG. Blasphemer of Night is your last best option if you don’t want to invest in a Psychube, and it’s great because it helps Willow Poison application.

Best Resonance Build For Willow In Reverse: 1999

Since Willow is built for DPS attacks, it’s best to use an ATK-centered Resonance build on her. You need to focus on getting as much flat ATK on her as much as possible to maximize her Poison damage bonus. Her main build for frequency would be Equibalance (Generalized), and her Alternate could be Placidity should you wish. Right now, that’s the best option for Willow in a mono Poison team — or any other you plan on slotting her into.

Best Team Compositions For Willow In Reverse: 1999

Since Willow is the first true Poison DPS In Reverse: 1999 , she is everything you need to complete your Poison team. She works extremely well with other Poison characters, but you can also pair her with other potential teams should you wish.

Willow + Tuesday + Sotheby

This is the ultimate Poison dream team you can create in Reverse: 1999 . Tuesday and Sotheby are both Plant Afflatus like Willow, and it’s been confirmed that Willow works best when Tuesday is in a team with her . Unfortunately, you might have to get Sotheby's Euphoria to accurately make use of the damage output. For the fourth spot, you can either use Kakania for healing, Mercuria for cosmic energy buffs, or Vila active critical buffs .

Willow + Tuesday + Isolde

The same can be said for this team if you don’t have Sotheby. Isolde makes a fine replacement as you can double down on Willow’s Poison damage when she’s on the field. For the fourth slot, feel free to use whichever character you like for either survivability or damage buffing.

Willow + Jessica + Sotheby + J

This is your ‘fake’ Poison team, and unfortunately, it's not the most recommended among players. But, this could be your temporary team until you have the opportunity to grab Tuesday when her banner releases. Quite frankly, Willow doesn’t work well unless you have Tuesday on your team . There will be a noticeable change in damage output, and Jessica is your substitute option until you get Tuesday. Willow and Jessica are both DPS here, so you can either bring in Kakania or Vila for Support if you want. Once you do get Tuesday, swap Jessica out for her and switch out Sotheby for J . J is a wild card as he provides great AoE burn application, which works well in certain situations.

item.title: Wuthering Waves Officially Reveals Cantarella's Rarity and Element
item.description:
Summary

  • Cantarella will make her playable debut during Version 2.2 of Wuthering Waves.
  • The character will be a 5-star Havoc unit who wields a Rectifier, making her the first character with this element and weapon combination.
  • Version 2.2 is set to arrive during the final week of March.

Wuthering Waves has confirmed Cantarella as a 5-star character debuting in Version 2.2. Previous leaks teased Cantarella's playable release during the next update of Wuthering Waves , but more Rinascita characters are expected to join the roster in later patches.

Earlier in February, Wuthering Waves launched its highly-anticipated 2.1 update. The patch introduced new explorable areas, a limited-time fishing event, and various quality-of-life features. Wuthering Waves also added two new game modes with weekly challenges and rewards, which have been fairly popular among players. Wuthering Waves ' latest playable characters, Phoebe and Brant, are solid DPS and support units, respectively. However, developer Kuro Games has already revealed its next addition to the roster.

Through a series of Twitter posts, Wuthering Waves has confirmed that the long-rumored Cantarella will make her playable debut in Version 2.2. She is a 5-star Havoc unit who wields a Rectifier, which makes her the first character with this element and weapon combination. According to her description, Cantarella is the thirty-sixth head of the Fisalia family from Rinascita. Cantarella's design is centered around jellyfish motifs, including her umbrella. Earlier leaks suggested that Wuthering Waves would release Aero Rover alongside Cantarella in Version 2.2, but developers have not formally announced Rover's next element yet.

Wuthering Waves Officially Reveals Cantarella's Debut for Version 2.2

Cantarella first appeared in Wuthering Waves ' latest story trailer, in which she is seen talking to Rover about the Sea of Ghosts. The trailer also showed cutscenes of Zani, Cartethyia, Phrolova, and the rumored Ciaccona. The trailer could suggest that these characters will join the roster during the 2.0 cycle. Wuthering Waves is expected to add several Resonators throughout 2025, so hopefully players won't have to wait until the next nation to pull for new units. On the other hand, per Kuro Games' usual drip marketing schedule, Cantarella would be the only new character for Wuthering Waves ' next update. While Cantarella's release could be exciting news for players, fans have been wondering about another character's playable debut. Zani was part of the first marketing campaign for Rinascita alongside other units like Carlotta and Brant, so players hoped she would be next in line to join the roster. However, it seems that won't be the case.

Wuthering Waves Version 2.2 is set to arrive during the final week of March. In the past, Kuro Games has expressed its resolve to address players' feedback regularly, and the 2.1 update included some highly-requested features, like an Echo Loadout system. This feature has put Wuthering Waves ahead of competitors like Genshin Impact , as fans of the HoYoverse title have long asked for an Artifact loadout system.

item.title: Go Go Muffin Codes (February 2025)
item.description:
Quick Links

  • All Go Go Muffin Codes
  • How to Redeem Go Go Muffin Codes
  • How to Get New Go Go Muffin Codes

Go Go Muffin is one of the best Idle RPGs for mobile platforms. There are many classes you can play, skills you can use, and items you can collect to equip your character. Also, the game has promo codes and you can redeem them to get some valuable bonuses. In this guide, you will find a list of all the Go Go Muffin codes and learn how you can use them to get helpful rewards in-game.

Updated February 21, 2025, by Artur Novichenko: New Go Go Muffin codes don’t drop too often, but when they do, they can be a great way to grab some extra in-game rewards. This guide is updated frequently, so check back for any new additions.

All Go Go Muffin Codes

Working Go Go Muffin Codes

  • WEEKEND2025 – Gives you rewards such as Gold, Star EXP, Pet Food and Raw Material.
  • MUFFINWEEKEND – Gives you rewards such as Gold, Star EXP, Pet Food and Raw Material.
  • LUCKSNAKE2025 – Gives you rewards such as Gold, Star EXP, Pet Food and Raw Material.
  • PARTYTIME – Gives you rewards such as Gold, Star EXP, Pet Food and Raw Material.
  • LUCKYMUFFIN – Gives you rewards such as Gold, Star EXP, Pet Food and Raw Material.
  • GoDanManREAL – Gives you rewards such as Gold, Star EXP, Pet Food and Raw Material.
  • HAPPY2025 – Gives you rewards such as Gold, Star EXP, Pet Food and Raw Material.
  • GOGONattoYT – Gives you rewards such as Gold, Star EXP, Pet Food and Raw Material.
  • MUFFINBUDDY – Gives you rewards such as Gold, Star EXP, Pet Food and Raw Material.
  • TimaeuSSMuff – Gives you rewards such as Gold, Star EXP, Pet Food and Raw Material.
  • WILDCATMUFFIN – Gives you rewards such as Gold, Star EXP, Pet Food and Raw Material.
  • VANOSSMUFFIN – Gives you rewards such as Gold, Star EXP, Pet Food and Raw Material.
  • DUALBLADE – Gives you a Back Attachment Cosmetic.
  • MUFFIN555 – Gives you x50 Stellarite, x300 Raw Material, and x10,000 Gold.
  • MUFFINGOGO – Gives you x100 Stellarite and x1 Summoning String.
  • MUFFIN – Gives you x100 Stellarite and x1 Summoning String.
  • MUFFINCREATOR – Gives you x50 Pet Food, x10,000 Gold, and x100 Star EXP.
  • TLPMUFFIN – Gives you x10,000 Gold, x1 Star Verses, and x10 Star Exp.
  • SUPERMUFFIN – Gives you the Super Muffin cape.
  • TIMAEUSSGOGO – Gives you x50 Pet Food, x1 Summoning String, and x10,000 Gold.
  • GOGOKAIROS – Gives you x50 Pet Food, x1 Summoning String, and x10,000 Gold.
  • GOGOHAVOC – Gives you x1,000 Raw Material, x10,000 Gold, and x2 Exploration Ticket.
  • MUFFINTOP – Gives you x1,000 Raw Material, x100 Rune Character, and x20,000 Gold.

Expired Go Go Muffin Codes

  • MUFFINGIFT – Gives you x100 Stellarite and x1 Star Verses.

Codes in Go Go Muffin are a great source of various useful resources. With their help, you will be able to get things like Gold, Stellarite, and Summoning Strings. All of these items can be really helpful and you definitely shouldn’t miss them.

The Seven Deadly Sins: Grand Cross Codes

How to Redeem Go Go Muffin Codes

The rewards you can get for redeeming Go Go Muffin codes are great, but you will need to learn how the redemption process works if you want to get them. Fortunately, it’s not that complicated, and you can claim your bonuses in a few simple steps, which are not very different from most other mobile games. Follow the instructions below to redeem Go Go Muffin codes and obtain your rewards:

  • Launch Go Go Muffin and wait for the game to load.
  • After that, tap your profile icon in the top left corner of the screen.
  • In the profile menu, tap the Gear icon to open the Settings menu.
  • Tap the Redeem Code button in the Settings menu.
  • Enter the code you want to redeem in the menu that pops up.
  • Tap the Confirm button. The reward will be sent to your Mail.

How to Get New Go Go Muffin Codes

The developers of Go Go Muffin constantly add codes to this mobile game, and this article will be updated if any new codes are released. You can bookmark this guide and check it for updates from time to time. It’s definitely worth it as the developers add new bonuses to the game quite often.

Go Go Muffin is available on mobile devices.

item.description:

  • The Seven Deadly Sins: Grand Cross Tips and Tricks
  • How to Get More The Seven Deadly Sins: Grand Cross Codes
  • The Best Anime Games Like The Seven Deadly Sins: Grand Cross Codes
  • About the The Seven Deadly Sins: Grand Cross Developers

In this article, players looking for freebies in The Seven Deadly Sins: Grand Cross will find various codes. By redeeming them, they'll be able to receive many valuable in-game rewards. However, users must remember that these codes can expire at anytime, so they must act quickly.

Updated February 21, 2025, by Artur Novichenko: If you want to make the most of your The Seven Deadly Sins: Grand Cross experience, redeeming the latest codes is a great way to do it. This list is always kept up to date, so you never miss out on free rewards.

All The Seven Deadly Sins: Grand Cross Codes

Codes Checked on February 21, 2025.

Working The Seven Deadly Sins: Grand Cross Codes

How to Redeem Codes in The Seven Deadly Sins: Grand Cross

Redeeming codes in this game is slightly different from other similar games and varies from platform to platform, so players can find step-by-step instructions below.

For PC and iOS Users

  • Visit The Seven Deadly Sins: Grand Cross code redemption website.
  • Find a Netmarble ID, which can be found under the player info section within the game.
  • Choose the server.
  • Enter the desired code into the designated "Enter coupon code" field.
  • Check the in-game mailbox for rewards.

For Android Users

  • Launch The Seven Deadly Sins: Grand Cross.
  • Tap the Menu button located in the bottom-right corner.
  • Select the "Misc" option.
  • Select the "Coupons" in the bottom left corner.
  • Enter the code and tap on the "Redeem" button.

The Seven Deadly Sins: Grand Cross Tips and Tricks

  • Daily Tasks: Begin each day by completing the tasks in the quest log, which depend on the story's progress.
  • Fort Solgres: In this dungeon, gather bugs, enhanced potions, and gold, while also earning SSR pendants.
  • PvP: Engage in ungeared PvP battles to improve rank and receive valuable rewards. Stay updated on evolving strategies.
  • Knighthood Boss: Collaborate with Knighthood for boss encounters, collecting Knighthood coins, and increasing rank for shop privileges.
  • Demonic Beast Battle: This mode becomes significant in the late game, providing holy relics for character improvements.
  • Prioritize the Storyline: It yields precious gems and unlocks crucial game elements.

How to Get More The Seven Deadly Sins: Grand Cross Codes

Players can find new codes on the developer's Twitter account, where they can also find news about updates and other interesting things. In addition, fans can bookmark this article to make sure they don't miss any new codes because this article is updated every month.

The Best Anime Games Like The Seven Deadly Sins: Grand Cross Codes

These days, players are spoiled for choice when it comes to anime-inspired video games, with hundreds of solid options all just a few clicks away. Below, players can find five of the best games like The Seven Deadly Sins: Grand Cross , all of which are well worth checking out.

  • One Punch Man: The Strongest
  • Bleach Blood War
  • DS - Blade of Hashira
  • ONE PIECE Bounty Rush
  • ONE PIECE TREASURE CRUISE

About the The Seven Deadly Sins: Grand Cross Developers

The Seven Deadly Sins: Grand Cross is developed by a fairly large and popular company - Netmarble. The company is located in South Korea and has already released numerous games for different tastes. Here are some of them:

  • Lineage 2: Revolution
  • Marvel Future Fight
  • BTS World
  • Blade & Soul Revolution

In March 2020, Netmarble earned on The Seven Deadly Sins: Grand Cross over 200 million dollars in revenue, and this was only at the start of the game. Now, the company continues to work on other games actively.

The Seven Deadly Sins: Grand Cross is available on PC, iOS, and Android.
